messages.message:
We should get back to MSFT with some AIs that will make it more feasible for us to deploy and run this at scale for our remaining customers. Off the top of my head:
1. reducing resource requirements
2. running replicas with the async api
3. removing the PV requirement (not all customers have PVs available)
4. disconnected container
5. reducing security vulnerabilities
Given what we've learnt from OCR, we should get ahead of these challenges for FR if we intend to deploy to more customers/for POCs. cc: @Aaron Tami @shaunak
1. running replicas with the async api -- how can MSFT solve it?
it has to be solved by us
we have to provide the concept of session_affinity in our RPC calls
They solved this for the OCR containers by building a mesh system. We could also support it with session_affinity if this primitive is exposed.
Yep, I meant -- there is no way MSFT can fix [2]  -- because the request get routed by the service load balancer, so we have to fix it
@Anant for (2) MSFT-OCR already supports a proper async system built on top of Redis and RabbitMQ
Is seems that they are trying to replace redis with PVs tho
